Title:
Multigene phylogenetics suggests the association of
Colletotrichum fructicola and C. siamense with chilli anthracnose in
India
Journal: Archives of Phytopathology and Plant Protection
Keywords:
Disease  Identification  Plant pathogen  Systematics 
Taxonomy
Abstract:
Chilli anthracnose is a major problem in India and
worldwide. In this study, we investigated the phylogenetic relationships
of 52 fungal isolates mainly associated with chilli anthracnose
collected from major chilli growing regions in southern India with
closely related, well-characterized Colletotrichum species. MP tree
based on the ITS/ 5.8S rRNA, actin, cal, chs1, gapdh and tub2 gene
sequence-data reveals that these fungal isolates constitute a
well-supported clade with the type strains of C. fructicola and C.
siamense. This is the first report of the involvement of C. fructicola
and C. siamense in chilli anthracnose in India.
